intro: Nototriche pedatiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Nototriche pedatiloba is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
